verb.description: Make (previously unknown or secret information) known to others.
examples: Brenda was forced to reveal Robbie's whereabouts
he revealed that he and his children had received death threats

noun.description: (in a movie or television show) a final revelation of information that has previously been kept from the characters or viewers.
examples: the big reveal at the end of the movie answers all questions

origin: Late 17th century: from obsolete revale to lower, from Old French revaler, from re- back + avaler go down, sink.
